```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
library(Amelia)
# library(stargazer)
# library(huxtable)
library(broom)
library(naniar)
```

This vignette is a scratchpad to work out how multiple imputation workflow in different packages, and the sort of helper functions that naniar could provide to support multiple imputation.

It draws a lot of ideas from Andrew Heiss's blog posts:

- https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2018/03/08/amelia-broom-huxtable/
- https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2018/03/07/amelia-tidy-melding/

```{r}
# Use the africa dataset from Ameila
data(africa)

# Build some example models
model_original1 <- lm(gdp_pc ~ trade + civlib, data = africa)
model_original2 <- lm(gdp_pc ~ trade + civlib + infl, data = africa)

set.seed(1234)

imp_amelia <-
  amelia(
    x = africa,
    m = 5,
    cs = "country",
    ts = "year",
    logs = "gdp_pc",
    p2s = 0
  )

shadow_africa <- as_shadow(africa)

bind_row_n <- function(data, n){
  
  tibble::as_tibble(data[rep(seq_len(nrow(data)), n), ])
  
}

bind_row_n(africa, 2)

# helper to bind the original shadow data `m` times
# adds .m option to as_shadow
africa %>%
  as_shadow() %>%
  bind_row_n(10) %>%
  mutate(m = rep("imp{1}"))

models_imputed_df <-
  bind_rows(unclass(imp_amelia$imputations), .id = "m") %>%
  group_by(m) %>%
  bind_cols(shadow_africa)
  nest() %>%
  mutate(model = data %>% map( ~ lm(gdp_pc ~ trade + civlib, data = .)))

models_imputed_df
```
